commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Now that we've decided on our slogan, let's start making some solid plans. It'd be good if we could list up all the things we have to do today.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Let's do it like today's the deadline for everything!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Hmm... So we need to talk about publicity, event operations, stands and booths...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hey, could I ask you guys somethin'?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What's up, Ai?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I sorta have an idea about what publicity involves, but what about stands and booths? And this whole operations side of things? I'm drawin' a blank here.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Oh, we put that on hold when we had our camp in Numazu, too.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Oh yeah... We got all carried away and never really got to that.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: By "stands," do you mean stalls? Like the candy apple stalls you might find at a cultural festival?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: While it could refer to stalls like that, cultural festivals operate on a much smaller scale than what we're dealing with.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It seems as though we may need to submit a fair amount of applications, orders, and other such external transactions ourselves for this event.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Sounds like a pain.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: I'm sure it'll be lots of fun if we all do it together.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Looks like Hanayo's more of a grown-up about this than you, Nico.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Y-You wanna go?!

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: My brain is getting fried thinking of all the stuff we gotta do...

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Well, it is as they say: no pain, no gain.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Hey, so about all that... Could you guys let us handle it?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Handle what, exactly?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: The event operations side of things.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: It would be really helpful if you could... But are you really okay with taking on all that work?

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Yes, all of us discussed this after the camp was over. We figured it would probably be better if Aqours played a more central role since we've helped run an event before.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: We should be able to provide at least a little bit of assistance with our experience.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: We really gave it our all for that event.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The Numazu Summer Festival, right? That takes me back.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: You helped us a lot with that festival too.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: We really appreciated how you stopped Yoshiko from going too wild, zura.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: It's YO-HA-NE! And what are you talking about? That was my best creation yet!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Yeah, you really did your best, Yoshiko.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I said it's Yohane!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: It'd be a big help if you could give us your assistance this time, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Say no more! I'll do anything I can to help out.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: So, what about the rest of you?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Your offer's really reassuring. Could we take you up on it?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Then consider yourself a passenger on Noah's Ark and leave it to me, Yohane!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: That's gonna make everyone even more worried, zura...

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: What's that supposed to mean?!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: That's enough from you two. First, we need to decide how many food stalls are required based on the number of anticipated visitors.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Since we're gathering all the nation's school idols, it'd be pretty cool if we could get together regional delicacies from across the country too.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I would love to see some dishes made especially for the event, too!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Oh? Sounds like it's time for my Special Deluxe Stewshine!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Mwa hah hah. The time has come for the Bloody Moon Sticks, otherwise known as the Tears of a Fallen Angel: Revolution, to make its grand return.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: I-It's gonna be super spicy again, huh...?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I'll make sure to whip up a child-friendly version as well this time.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: We'll need to put up some guideposts around the venue as well.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We gotta have an area for kids who get lost too, 'cause otherwise they'll just be lost with nowhere to go.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Then we should get some toys so the kids don't get bored waiting for their parents to come get them, too!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Hanamaru and I will write up the announcement scripts again. Sound good to you, Hanamaru?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Yup!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Given what a big event this is turning out to be, might I suggest some limited-edition merchandise?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: W-Wow... The list of things we have to do just keeps getting longer and longer...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Here I always just dropped in on these things. I had no idea it took this much planning. I guess it takes more than just gusto to make a live show come alive...

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: It takes more than gusto to make a pun land too, Ai.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: C'mon, it wasn't that bad, was it?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: It sounds like fun, but all this important stuff keeps coming up. Rina-chan Board says, "Confused."

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Come on, guys. I get that you're surprised, but you've got to contribute. Aqours might be taking the lead, but that doesn't mean you can just dump this all on them.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Indeed, it would make things much easier for us if you speak up.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Oh, me, me! I've got an idea! Listen to me!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Everyone's getting so into it... Better roll my sleeves up and help out as much as I can too!)
